channel.title: Comments on: Rethinking Class Notes with OneNote
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/08/30/rethinking-class-notes-with-onenote/#comment-393">Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace)</a>.
Hi Clara,
Yes, we are 1:1 MacBooks, with full Office 365 online subscriptions for all students. Most importantly, this means they all can access Class Notebooks using their school email addresses.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace).

Hi Clara,

Yes, we are 1:1 MacBooks, with full Office 365 online subscriptions for all students. Most importantly, this means they all can access Class Notebooks using their school email addresses.

item.title: By: Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace)
item.dc:creator: Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace)
item.description: We use one note at the teacher level for department, curriculum, and personal. I will have to see if we can extend that to student. Is your school 1:1?
item.content:encoded: We use one note at the teacher level for department, curriculum, and personal. I will have to see if we can extend that to student. Is your school 1:1?

item.title: By: Darren Kuropatwa
item.dc:creator: Darren Kuropatwa
item.description: This sounds great Evan! I'm sure adding links is only the first of many enhancements the students will be adding to your class notebooks. (Thanks for tagging me. ;-))
item.content:encoded: This sounds great Evan! I’m sure adding links is only the first of many enhancements the students will be adding to your class notebooks. (Thanks for tagging me. ;-))
